thread.title: Astronomers Say They’ve Spotted A Massive Asteroid Hurtling Toward Earth Today
thread.title_full: Astronomers Say They’ve Spotted A Massive Asteroid Hurtling Toward Earth Today

author: John Haltiwanger
title: Astronomers Say They’ve Spotted A Massive Asteroid Hurtling Toward Earth Today
text:
The asteroid will fly between the Earth and the moon today, February 2, sometime around 3:30 pm EST. 
Astronomers discovered the asteroid, dubbed 2017 BS32, just a few days ago, according to MailOnline . The space rock is estimated to be somewhere between 36 to 82 feet, or roughly the size of a double-decker bus. How an asteroid strike would create devastating tsunami To view this video please enable JavaScript, and considerupgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Fortunately, in spite of its late discovery, asteroid 2017 BS32 will not hit Earth and cause all of us to die in the disaster of all disasters. 
Asteroid 2017 BS32 will be just 100,214 miles from the Earth at the time of its closet approach, which is 60 percent closer than the moon, according to Slooh . This is not the first time an asteroid has come close to our beloved planet this year. Newly discovered asteroid #2017BX will be whizzing by us Tuesday 11:54 PM EST at just over half the distance to the Moon! pic.twitter.com/JYflDcHrJ2
